info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 9:03PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL SANGAMON AND NORTHEASTERN MORGAN COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 903 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Alexander, or 11 miles east of Jacksonville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Alexander, New Berlin, Literberry, Berlin, Sinclair, and Jacksonville Municipal Airport. This includes Interstate 72 between mile markers 69 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
